fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user is trying to synchronize JIRA Software release with the linked issues in JIRA Service Desk. Currently they are unable to have some form of trigger action from the Release section of a Software Project, whenever a version is released in JIRA Software, the system updates the linked issues in JIRA Service Desk and e.g. (It sends a special queue of released issues)
h3. Suggested Solution

User would like to automate this process so that Customer Service gets automated updates whenever an issue is released and it notifies the customers in JIRA Service Desk environment. 
h3. Why this is important

This will allow a smoother communication between the customer and the user's production, to keep the customer's updated equally and a better back and forth between customer being informed and the production being released.
fields.summary: Trigger Version Release in JIRA Software and Automate Update on Linked Issues in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Automation rules that should be executed based on SLA outcomes are not being triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1 - Create an SLA. E.g: "Time waiting for Customer Response".
2 - Create an Automation rule like the following:
{panel}- When: SLA Breached - "Time waiting for Customer Response"
- IF: Any Issue
- Then: Transition Issue - Resolve.{panel}
3 - Create an issue and wait for the SLA to breach.

h3. Expected Results

When the SLA breaches, the issue should be transitioned to "Resolved".

h3. Actual Results

The SLA does not trigger the automation rule. The issue is not transition and nothing is displayed on the automation logs.
 
h3. How to diagnose:

The following queries return jobs scheduled to the past.


{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM "AO_F1B27B_PROMISE"
WHERE "STATUS" = 'SCHEDULED' AND "TARGET_TIME_MILLIS" < (extract(epoch from now()) * 1000);
{code}

{code:sql}SELECT * FROM clusteredjob WHERE job_id = 'com.atlassian.scheduler.timedpromise.internal.TimedPromiseExecutor.job';{code}
  

h3. Notes

Other automation rules do not seem to be impacted by the bug.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: SLA dependent automation rules are not being triggered.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Licensed Confluence users and JIRA admins without JIRA application access cannot access customer portal or create tickets via email
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Version: JIRA Service Desk - 1000.1931.0
 * 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user and add them to "jira-administrators" or "administrators" groups
 # Add the user to the JSD project Customer list or Service Desk Customer role
 # Make sure customer permission allows *anyone* to access the portal
 # Access the portal or send an email to the Email Request

h3. Expected Results

Access portal successfully or requests created via email
h3. Actual Results
 * If the user tries to access the portal, error shows *You don't have permission to view this portal.*
 * If the user sends an email to create a request, email log shows: *You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.*

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
 The same result for JIRA admins access without application access.
 Users without *any* application access has no problems accessing the portal
You won't be able to raise tickets on behalf of the user. 
h3. Workaround

Grant JIRA application access to enable creating requests
fields.summary: Admins without JIRA application access cannot access portal or create tickets via email

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when email request is enabled on a project, a demo ticket will be created with the text "This service desk project has been configured to receive customer requests via email."
h3. Suggested Solution

Admins have the assumption that any emails sent will create a ticket without knowing that customer permission would need to be configured.
fields.summary: Add information regarding customer permission to demo tickets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Service Desk is depending on *Request Type* value for:-
# Displayed at Customer Portal
# Enable notification to customer

However, this causes both actions are too dependent on "Request Type" value and it will not work if the value is empty. It is a big impact if the business is depending on customer notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Provide option not to use "Request Type" value

h3. Why this is important
 Despite having a way to update "Request Type" using automation, it still not convenient for admins when "Request Type" is not inserted the notification is not working and the customer can't view the issue from the portal.

h3. Workaround 
# Edit Request Type using Automation if user created issue via JIRA
# Make sure to use "Raise a Request" option and fill up customer user name for "Raise this request on behalf of" value.
fields.summary: Make JIRA Service Desk not depend on request types and have that as an option

Currently, customizing Project Email Address has no effect on the notifications sent to customer when:

!2017-08-21_15-44-19.png!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There’s a very specific situation, where the Automation Rule logs show that a Request Type change failed with this error:
{code}
The request type you are trying to view does not exist.
{code}

Though the change is actually successful. Even though the situation is very specific, it was reliably reproducible in every case.

Check ‘steps to reproduce’ below to know how to reproduce

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project with some Request Type
# Add an Automation Rule with this:
#* WHEN: Issue Created
#* IF: Any Item
#* THEN:
#** Add comment (with any text)
#** Edit Request Type (add a request type)
#* You can actually have several other THEN, as long as those two are there and *in the order presented above* (we cannot replicate it if we add comments before the Request Type change)
#* This problem also doesn’t happen if we don’t add the rule that adds comments (though I’m unsure what the connection is)
# Create a ticket in JIRA using the ‘Create’ button on the top, *not in Customer Portal* (so it’s created without a Request Type)
#* The Issue Type select must be one compatible with the Request Type used in the Automation Rule above

h3. Expected Results
# Automation Rule works
# Automation logs show Status as {{SUCCESS}}

h3. Actual Results
# Automation rule does work and Request Type is correctly edited (and comment added)
# However, logs show as {{ERROR}} with this message:
{code}
Edit request type: <Request type>
The request type you are trying to view does not exist.
{code}
!request_type_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
It's important to point that the automation rule works, it's just the logs that show it doesn't.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Comment rule may cause error in Automation Rule log

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk Queue page does not load when the queue JQL contains a deleted field or status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new queue in Service Desk project which contains a status or any other field;
# Delete the status or the field;
# Reload the queue.

h3. Expected Results

The queue page loads or gives an error about the missing status.

h3. Actual Results
The Page shows an infinite loading icon.
An error 500 is thrown in the Developer Console.
 
h3.Workaround
If possible, recreate the missing status or field > remove from the queue JQL > delete the created status or field.
If nothing of it works, create a ticket with the Atlassian support mentioning this bug.
fields.summary: Service Desk Queue page does not load with incorrect JQL

When username have Capital letter, *Open Request* and *Close Request* is not updated at Organization page.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1877.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer starting with Capital Letter , for example AbcDef@gmail.com
# Add user to an organization
# Create issue on behalf of user

h3. Expected Results
*Open Request* number is updated.

h3. Actual Results
*Open Request* number is not updated.

h3. Notes
It also happen when issue already resolved. *Close Request* is not updated

h3.Workaround
Update from the database. Change the username to from capital letter to lower letter. For example (abcdef@gmail.com). This only can be done by support.

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Provide ability for Knowledge Based search for filename

fields.description:
JIRA Service Desk comes with built-in reports for "Article usage" and "Article effectiveness". However, the metrics "Article views" and "Problems solved by articles" are only shown at an aggregate level.  There is no indication of which articles were viewed, or which articles helped solve a problem. 

As an agent, I would like to know:
 * How many times each article was viewed within the customer portal
 * For each article, actual responses to "Did this article help?"  This would include number of "Yes" responses, number of "No" responses, and number of times the question was not answered. 

For example, this could be shown in a summary table with a row for each article, and a column for each metric.  To simplify the display, the data could be shown for one time period at a time.
fields.summary: Add details to Article usage and Article effectiveness reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, admin can set default approver by setting the default value for the field. However, it can't be set depending on Organization. For example:-
Organization A has default approver ABC
Organization B has default approver DEF

The workaround is to use Automation. But, this field will not be displayed in the Customer Portal. Admin requires this field to display in the Customer Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option for admin to set the default approver and display it to Customer Portal.

h3. Why this is important
Admin can set the default approver by the organization and let it display in Customer Portal.

h3. Workaround 
Configure using Automation , but the field will not be display in Customer Portal
fields.summary: Allow admin to configure default Approval depending with Organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As we all know, JIRA Service Desk issue need to have "Request Type" information in order notification to customer works. However, this was not mentioned in the [Managing service desk notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html] documentation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Highlight to the user that "Request Type" value is needed in order notification to be working if they create issue directly from JIRA.

h3. Why this is important
Most of the notification failed was due to "Request Type" is with no value. The users are not known about this because it's not mentioned in the documentation.
fields.summary: Update "Managing service desk notifications" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Receiving requests by email on Service Desk is generating multiple issues. 

h3. Environment
JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1830.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up an email address to receive email requests on JIRA Service Desk project (custom or default).
# Send an email request to the address.

h3. Expected Results
It will create a request.

h3. Actual Results
It's creating multiple entries for the same issue.

h3. Notes 
Checked in the database and found that there are multiple entries with the same MAIL_ITEM_ID and message_id. 

i.e
Get the MAIL_ITEM_ID through the issue key:
{code}SELECT * FROM "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT"  WHERE "ISSUE_KEY" = 'ISSUEKEY-123'; {code}
{code}CREATED_TIMESTAMP,FROM_ADDRESS,HANDLER_NAME_KEY,ID,ISSUE_KEY,MAIL_CHANNEL_ID,MAIL_CHANNEL_NAME,MAIL_ITEM_ID,MESSAGE,NO_OF_RETRY,RESULT_STATUS,SUBJECT,UPDATED_TIMESTAMP
1501866722503,example@example.com,Service Desk Mail Handler,52149,ISSUEKEY=123,2,example@example.com.br,86847,,0,SUCCESS,E-mails,1501866722503{code}

Then search for the MAIL_ITEM_ID:
{code}SELECT * FROM "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT"  WHERE "MAIL_ITEM_ID" = 86847; {code}

{code}CREATED_TIMESTAMP,FROM_ADDRESS,HANDLER_NAME_KEY,ID,ISSUE_KEY,MAIL_CHANNEL_ID,MAIL_CHANNEL_NAME,MAIL_ITEM_ID,MESSAGE,NO_OF_RETRY,RESULT_STATUS,SUBJECT,UPDATED_TIMESTAMP
1501682455838,charlie@example.com,Service Desk Mail Handler,27013,'ISSUEKEY=123',9,charlie@example.atlassian.net,26955,,0,SUCCESS,Emailing from copy machine ,1501682455838
1501682484578,charlie@example.com,Service Desk Mail Handler,27013,'ISSUEKEY=123',9,charlie@example.atlassian.net,26955,,0,SUCCESS,Emailing from copy machine ,1501682484578
1501682499992,charlie@example.com,Service Desk Mail Handler,27013,'ISSUEKEY=123',9,charlie@example.atlassian.net,26955,,0,SUCCESS,Emailing from copy machine ,1501682499992
{code}

It should have only 1 entry. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Email requests generating multiple tickets
Slow System- Noticed the issue was reported and resolved yesterday, however I noticed this issue is still a problem.

fields.description:
Many support organizations align their support resources with their customer base. If a new ticket is created, it would be nice if the new ticket notification included the submitter's organization name if they are associated with an organization. This helps from a triage standpoint if the submitter's organization is visible in the notification, as it helps determine some initial routing of the support issue. I see one of two options:
 # Concatenate the Organization name to the end of the Submitter name in the notification (if an Organization association exists).
 # Add a new dedicated line called Organization and disclose the organization that the submitter is associated with.
fields.summary: Include Organization Name In New Ticket Notification Email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we change the project key of an SD project and then access an SD configuration page for this project using an URL with the old key, the page remains blank and refreshing, without showing the content.

This is happening to SD configuration pages, such as 'Request Types' and 'Email Requests', but not JIRA configuration pages, present also in business and software projects, like 'Issue Types'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project (say, key ABC)
# Make sure you have Agent access
# Edit the project key to something else (say DEF)
# Access an SD configuration page using the URL with the old key:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/ABC/request-types
{code}

h3. Expected Results
JIRA redirects to the correct page in project:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/DEF/request-types
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The page is blank and keeps refreshing indefinitely.
 
h3. Notes
We can see the link to old key in database:
{code:sql}
jira_965706=> select p.id, p.pkey, pk.project_key from project p join project_key pk on p.id = pk.project_id  where  pk.project_key in ('ABC');
  id   |  pkey   | project_key 
-------+---------+-------------
 11900 | DEF | ABC
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use link with current key.
fields.summary: SD project pages keep refreshing when using old project key to access them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, agents cannot reset passwords or change account details of customers without being a member of the _site-admins_ group.

h3. Suggested Solution

An agent should be able to administer customers as they are simply customers of the Service Desk.
fields.summary: Allow agents to manage customers

fields.description:
Spawn a JIRA software ticket from a custom field value in Jira Service Desk.

We sometimes have multiple departments that perform a unique action for new hires.  Some of these departments are not permitted JIRA Service Desk Agent licenses, so we would like the ability to auto create a related ticket in a JIRA Software project to handle the onboard process.
fields.summary: Spawn a JIRA software ticket from a custom field value in Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
I'd like to create a queue in our Service Desk project that shows the tickets that have not had an external comment in the past 3 days. 

I'm unable to find a way to filter by the external comment field when setting up a queue.
fields.summary: Service Desk Queue – last external comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unlicensed customers will not be able to access Confluence from mobile device if they activated Mobile view

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-1c5ac9c

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project 
# Set the KB to "Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license."
# Create an Unlicensed Service Desk Customer
# Let the customer access Confluence through Mobile with activated Mobile view

h3. Expected Results
* Service Desk Customer should be able to access Confluence page from Mobile device with activated mobile view

h3. Actual Results
* Service Desk Customer can access the Confluence page through Desktop but unable to access Confluence from mobile device with activated Mobile view
* Getting 403 error

h3. Note
* There is no option to switch back to Desktop View once you activated Mobile view
fields.summary: Service Desk Customers unable to access Confluence from mobile device with activated Mobile view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a project with sample data shows an error message

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a Service Desk project, making sure to select the 'use sample data' option
# Give the project a name and key, and click 'Submit'

h3. Actual Result 
An "Unexpected failure occured" error message is displayed

h3. Expected Result
The is created successfully with sample data

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Cannot create project with sample data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Jira Service Desk customer portal landing page form can't be customized using CSS. Administrators expect to have similar template as Contact Support page ( https://support.atlassian.com/contact )

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option for admin to customize the form.

h3. Why this is important
There is a disconnect between the Atlassian support contact page, and the landing pages that are found within Jira Service Desk customer portals.  Jira admins expect to have either own product to have the same or equivalent features that Atlassian's own support uses.
fields.summary: Ability to customize Customer Portal Form same as Contact Support page

fields.description:
*Who's impacted*
Instances having https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/FD-601 enabled and who have uploaded a customer portal logo after July 7th

*Symptoms*
The customer portal logo won't show up
fields.summary: Media Services stored customer portal logos don't load (calls to API fail with a 500)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If using an apostrophe (') in the name of SLA and search in the dropdown box, when creating a new metric,  JIRA renders the SLA name and put a wrong character d' instead of the apostrophe (').


Steps to Reproduce

# Create an SLA name with apostrophe;
# Create a new metric;
# Select the SLA with the apostrophe;
# After selecting the SLA, JIRA renders the apostrophe with the wrong character.

!search_sla_french.png|thumbnail!

!render_sla_french.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results

JIRA renders the apostrophe correctly

h3. Actual Results

A wrong character appears (d') instead of apostrophe

h3. Notes



h3.Workaround

NA
fields.summary: SLA name picker doesn't encode apostrophes correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A customer logged in on the Customer Portal should be able see the JIRA issues on the macro of a Linked KB from Confluence on the customer portal after allowing All logged in users to the 'Browse Projects' permission. However, Once the page loads, the issues will be shown, but if you click on the refresh button of the macro, the alert will come: "JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.". Permission Helper shows that customer's user has the 'Browse Projects' permission.

Also, if convert the customers to Atlassian Account, it Throws the follwoing error: "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error."
{code}"timestamp":"2017-07-27T13:17:51,984Z"
"level":"WARN"
"product":"jira"
"logger":"com.atlassian.applinks.internal.capabilities.DefaultRemoteCapabilitiesService"
"message":"Exception trying to get Applink for manifest with ID 669ecc51-3b86-3b2f-bcec-aa91c3e60b0a"
"tenantId":"1af07e44-6eea-4691-8cae-33c0bcb2552e"
"location":{"class":"com.atlassian.applinks.internal.capabilities.DefaultRemoteCapabilitiesService","method":"getApplinkSafe","line":"271"}
"url":"/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/327685"
"username":"rodrigo.becker@e-core.com"{code}

h3. Environment
Cloud
Confluence 1000.0.0-e91264e
JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1731.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow any logged in user to the 'Browse Projects' permission for the project tested.
# Get to the project's 'Knowledge Base' section and check the box to allow anyone to read articles without a Confluence license.
# Have a knowledge base created using the JIRA issue macro listing issues from any project. (ie: The own JSD project)
# Log in to the customer portal with a portal-only customer account.
# Search for the knowledge base and open it.

h3. Expected Results
Issues are listed.

h3. Actual Results
Once the page loads, the issues will be shown, but if you click on the refresh button of the macro, the same alert will come: "JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." 

If convert the customers to Atlassian Account, it Throws the follwoing error: "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error."
{code}"timestamp":"2017-07-27T13:17:51,984Z"
"level":"WARN"
"product":"jira"
"logger":"com.atlassian.applinks.internal.capabilities.DefaultRemoteCapabilitiesService"
"message":"Exception trying to get Applink for manifest with ID 669ecc51-3b86-3b2f-bcec-aa91c3e60b0a"
"tenantId":"1af07e44-6eea-4691-8cae-33c0bcb2552e"
"location":{"class":"com.atlassian.applinks.internal.capabilities.DefaultRemoteCapabilitiesService","method":"getApplinkSafe","line":"271"}
"url":"/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/327685"
"username":"rodrigo.becker@e-core.com"{code}

h3.Workaround
Allow Anyone group to the 'Browse Projects' permission, but from a security perspective, it is highly not recommended as anybody logged in or anonymous will be able to search through the project's issues, both on Confluence as well as on the JIRA project.
fields.summary: Browse projects permission being override by Service Desk/Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There's 2 scenario:-

First scenario : Drag image from Outlook 2016 to Customer Portal with any browser (IE , Chrome) is not working. 
Second scenario : Copy image from Outlook 2016 and paste to comment field in issues at Customer Portal with any browser (IE , Chrome) is not working. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1715.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
First Scenario:-
# Have an email with image at Outlook 2016
# Open issue in Customer Portal
# Drag the image from Outlook to attach it to issue.

Second Scenario:-
# Copy image from the email at Outlook 2016
# Open issue in Customer Portal
# Paste the image from Outlook to comment field.

h3. Expected Results
Both scenario : Image successfully attached.

h3. Actual Results
First Scenario: Attachment is not attached. Nothing happening in the Customer Portal
Second scenario : Below error return:-
 !outlook.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Save the image to local. Then , attach it manually to issues.
fields.summary: Attach image from Outlook 2016 to Customer Portal is not working

fields.description:
The link to articles on the "related knowledge base articles" panel is incorrect *if they are opened in a new tab* (href is wrong, but dialog works correctly).
Example of bad href: [https://[instance-name]/wikihttps://[instance-name]/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/view/1900684]

 

Workaround: As the dialog works correct, the workaround is to use dialog instead of opening the link in new tab
fields.summary: The link to articles on the "related knowledge base articles" panel is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Submitting email with same image filename as existing image attachment in Service Desk ticket will result in displaying

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a Service Desk Ticket
# Submit a comment through email which contains image A with filename Capture.jpg
# Submit a comment through email which contains image B with filename Capture.jpg

h3. Actual Result 
Image A will be for showing up for 1st and 2nd Comment
After a while and refresh, Image B will be for showing up for 1st and 2nd Comment and stays.

h3. Expected Result
Image A displays for 1st Comment
Image B displays for 2nd Comment

h3. Workaround
Specify a unique image filename before submitting comment
fields.summary: Submitting email with same image name in existing ticket will display different image with the same name

Customer should able to open Customer Portal

Enable anonymous access on your service desk configuration

None

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When moving a ticket from project to another there are some fields which might have invalid values for a new project - Organisation, Participants, Approvers. For example, when users in those fields dont' have access for both projects. There should be an option during move to update those fields during move

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue in on JSD project with filled up Organisation, Participants, Approvers fields
# Move the ticket to another JSD project which doesn't have same customer base

h3. Expected Results

User should see fields, which need to be updated and decide either update the fields or grant access to the project for those users

h3. Actual Results

The ticket will have all fields fill up with the wrong values (users will not see this ticket and will not get notification about it update). 

h3.Workaround

Clean up those fields manually after move
fields.summary: Moving JSD ticket to another project doesn't clean up JSD field values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the last visited page was JSD Queue page, clicking *Back to JIRA* from User Management page will return wrong URL.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1643.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any JSD queue page, for example (https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/projects/KEY/queues/custom/1)
# Then, go to *User Management* page.
# Then, click *Back to JIRA*

h3. Expected Results
It will go back to https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/projects/KEY/queues/custom/1 page

h3. Actual Results
It go to https://<INSTANCE>atlassian.net/secure/ProjectAppAction.jspa?projectKey=KEY&page=queues . This URL is not valid and causes an infinite loop which make the page keep on loading.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
# When already in the infinite page , stop the page from loading. 
# Then, open a different page, for example, click *Project > Select the project*.
fields.summary: Wrong URL return from User Management when last visited page is Queue page

*Prerequisites*:
Have JSD project and Organizations to be set
 
*Steps*:
1. Issues-> Search for issue -> Choose only JIRA issues (without JSD) -> Bulk change ->

2. Choose Issue -  Choose only JIRA issues (without JSD)

3. Choose Operation - Edit Issue

4.  Operation Details -> Unavailable Actions -> Find here "Change Organizations" and "Change Request Type"

*Actual behavior:*

The note for the Organizations and Request Type field is insufficient, cause I do have a Service Desk and I'm an administrator too:
 * Change Organizations
{color:#FF0000}NOTE:{color} Service Desk is not enabled or you do not have permission to perform this action. Please enable and configure your service desk first.
 * Change Request Type
{color:#FF0000}NOTE:{color} Service Desk is not enabled or you do not have permission to perform this action. Please enable and configure your service desk first.

See the attachments.

*Expected behavior:* 

If the selected issues are Jira-based, not JSD, I'd prefer to see message with similar meaning to _"Bulk editing for Service Desk Organizations is not supported in JIRA Project"_

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA Service Desk Project
# Go to Customer page (for example: https://xeelon.atlassian.net/projects/ISD/customers)
# Add one customer
# You will see that under 'Open Requests' there is 0 open and under 'Closed Requests' there is 0 closed
# Click on Raise requests menu on the left
# Raise a request on behalf of customer (put the name of customer in the raise this request on behalf of column)
# Fill in the neccessary fields and click Create
# Go back to customers page (https://xeelon.atlassian.net/projects/ISD/customers)

h3. Expected Results
The issue should appear in 'Open Requests' column, so it should be showing as 1 open

h3. Actual Results
The issue appear in 'Closed Requests' column, so it is showing as 1 closed. Clicking on this does not return any results

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: Raising a request on behalf of customer will increment the 'Closed Requests', instead of 'Open Requests' in customer page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently, the Customer page displays links to view the requests on Open and Closed requests for organizations.
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options for admins to choose, either links or number of requests
h3. Why this is important
Instead of being able to see the collective number of requests by the organization, users would need to view them in another link which taking away functionality and usefulness.
h3. Workaround
If you want to see number of Created vs Resolved issue per Organization you can create a new customer Report
# Go to Reports
# Create new Report
# Add new series and enter jql for your Organization
reporter in organizationMembers("My Organization") 
# Add as may series as you need (you can have all Organizations on one report or different)
fields.summary: Display number instead of links for the Open and Closed request for organizations

fields.description:
h3. Fixed
CSV export has now been fixed. It does export to organization field values IDs, and they are able to be re-imported as is.

----

h3. Summary

The organization field exported value format is incorrect (e.g. it's the Java toString() serialisation of the class representing an organization), hence import of this value isn't recognized and can't be mapped to the existing Organization field hence issue created without organization set.

h3. Environment
 * Affected version - 1000.1092.0 (Cloud)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import CSV with Issue Key, Summary and Organization
 # Organization in format: CustomerOrganizationImpl \{id="organization ID", name="Organization name"}
 
 h3. Expected Results
 Issue is imported and Organization field has value
 
 h3. Actual Results
 Issue is imported without Organization value
 
 h3.Workaround
 In the CSV file, replace:
 ** _CustomerOrganizationImpl\{id="organization ID", name="Organization name"}_
 ** by the _organization ID_ value (without quotes) 
and import should work correctly
{code:sql}Issue key,Summary,Custom field (Organizations)
SDT-15,set up and ready to use,1{code}
see attached file  [^current_correct_format.csv]
fields.summary: CSV import does not recognize incorrectly exported Organization custom field value format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Get started JIRA Service Desk documentation for "Make queues for your team", it uses issue type example that did not exist for the customer. Based on the documentation, it asked the user to add "Access" issue type. But in reality, it did not exist by default.

Below is the link to the documentation:-
https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-service-desk/make-queues-for-your-team-917968317.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide clearer instruction, for example, use "Task" issue type.

h3. Why this is important
The user will confuse because of the issue type in documentation is not exist in their instance.
fields.summary: Improvise on Get started JIRA Service Desk documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
An inconsistency was found on Service Desk, if users on the Service Desk Team project role are under the project's customers as well, the system will consider the agent as a customer. What can cause problems with notifications to no be sent due to this configuration:

* *JIRA Administrator > Applications > JIRA Service Desk > Notifications*
 {quote}Should customers receive JIRA notifications?
* No, only send JIRA Service Desk notifications to customers (recommended)
* Yes, send customers both JIRA Service Desk and JIRA notifications {quote}
 
Normally, when adding an user under the Service Desk Team project role, the user is automatically removed from the project's customers. But when adding the user on an organization, it will cause conflicts on the notifications. Therefore, even that the Notification helper shows that the Agents should receive the notifications for certain actions they will not receive it.

h3. Expected Results
*The Notification helper shows that the Agent should receive the notifications for certain action and it works.*

h3. Actual Results
The Notification helper shows that the Agent should receive the notifications for certain actions but due to determined configurations from Service Desk such as roles (SD Team/Customers) the Agent will not receive the notifications.
fields.summary: Enhance the notification helper

fields.description:

h3. Workaround
[Default value of custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-a-custom-field-776636423.html#Configuringacustomfield-Howtosetthedefaultvalueforacustomfield] partially provides similar feature. However it's unavailable to populate arbitrary values for each links to the same field.
fields.summary: Adopt field population feature to help center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting a JSD project will not purge all the project's data from the database. Some JSD tables like _AO\_54307E\_QUEUE_ will still have data from this deleted project after the project was already deleted. This will cause orphaned data in the database that may affect imports to other JIRAs if one is done.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created a JSD project
# Check the _AO\_54307E\_QUEUE_ table to see its data
# Delete this project

h3. Expected Results
No leftovers in the database from this deleted project.
h3. Actual Results
You can still see data relevant to this deleted project if you check the _AO\_54307E\_QUEUE_ table after the project is deleted.
 
h3. Notes
If you run the following SQL it will show you orphaned data that is no longer in the _project_ table but still in the _AO\_54307E\_QUEUE_ table.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Deleting a JSD project will not purge all its data from the database

fields.description:
Confluence Users landing on Service Desk Portal

h3. Summary

Confluence users land on Service Desk portal page, even when they are not customers SD Projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk.
# Restrict the project by setting cutomer permissions to: "Customers my team adds to the project" and do not invite anyone to the project.
# Create a Confluence user.
# Log in as the Confluence user.

h3. Expected Results

You'll land in Confluence: (https://site.atlassian.net/wiki)

h3. Actual Results

You actually land in JIRA Service Desk portal (https://site.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal), with no visibility to SD projects.


h3.Workaround
Change the landing product to Confluence, as referenced in the following article:

* [Set your site's landing product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html]
fields.summary: Confluence Users landing on Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is a common case that a service desk ticket is linked to another JIRA Issue (bug) where the customer has no access. In such situation, updates on the bug cannot be seen by customers and it requires manual work from service desk agent to copy updates from the linked JIRA Issue (bug) to the customer facing service desk ticket.

At the moment, it is only possible to make an automation of *Update when a linked issue changes*. The automation can transition the service desk ticket to a certain status but not sync any updates.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow an automation of syncing updates from the linked issue to the service desk ticket. A rule to check which updates from the linked issue is meant for customer communication would also help.

h3. Why this is important

This could eliminate a lot of manual work for service desk agents to update the customer facing tickets manually.
 
h3. Workaround

The Automation feature has a component to manipulate linked issues:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-27 at 15.13.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automated sync of updates from linked issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Atlassian Cloud administrators are unable to change the email address for portal only customers. 

This is sometimes necessary as customers may change their email or domain for different reasons. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow site-admins to perform this change.

h3. Workaround 

The only possible alternative would be to create new customer accounts using the new email addresses and manually add those accounts as the reporter or request participant in the active tickets that still need to be followed up.
fields.summary: Allow site administrators to change portal only customers email addresses

fields.description: It will be nice if customers can export their list of issues to CSV or Excel for reporting purposes.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As an agent I search for the customer on Customers page but cannot get any result back if customer has a JSD license 

h3. Steps to reproduce

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When the search string on the _JIRA Service Desk Customer portal_ contains a question mark, Confluence returns no results if the title of the page has a ? in it.
h4. How to reproduce

Open a JIRA Service Desk Customer portal that is linked to a Confluence Service Desk space. eg. {{<base_url>/servicedesk/customer/portals}}.

Search string: *branch?* - will return no results
Search string: *branch ?* - will return no results
Search string: *branch* - will return results

Assuming there is a Confluence page with the title that contains the word *branch*.
Searching for any of the above search strings in Confluence do return results.
h4. Expected Result

Expected Confluence to have returned the same results irrespective of the question mark.
h4. Actual Result
 * No results are returned from Confluence.
 * The actual JIRA Service Desk JSON request to <base_url>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sharedportal/kb/articles?query=branch+%3F returns an empty JSON response.

h4. Workaround

Omit the "?" from the search string
fields.summary: KB searching of Confluence pages with ? in them is broken
